title: The Real issue that the new jungle has introduced.
body:
So i'm a jungle main, have been mostly for 3 seasons now, and i have to say, in my personal opinion this jungle change is the worst by far, and i will explain this point by point.

**Plants**

Now before you go complaining, hear me out on this one, i like plants, but the issue is what in the jungle they were forced to replace.

Plants are a thing that make the winning jungler win by more, to stop vision gaining on the enemy you used to have to counter jungle the entire raptor camp AND wolf camp, to actually force a denial of vision, now all you need to do is contribute 1 auto attack to clear the plant and force the jungler into a worse place.

Then there is honey fruits, this is probably the worst executed plant of the 3, in that it's basically if your randomly lucky enough to run into one, you get health and mana back, and can just get off another gank for free, and to counter that, you can just take it on full health and waste the plant.

**Jungle Respawns**

Jesus christ does this hurt so many junglers, you used to have to (and realistically still do) farm up to try and catch up if your team starts to fall behind, and focus on the counter ganking rather than actually ganking, because you would generally be behind enough to not be able to gank well.

Now, you just have nothing, if your team is behind at all your fucked, especially if the enemy jungler starts countering you, you will have no way in hell to actually get into the game, and this can lead to massive gaps in gold, simply because your not lucky with the team you rolled.

**Jungle Pathing**

So Jungle pathing used to actually be rather dynamic, you go to the smite you need when it's up, and actually dynamically choose a path around that.

Now your forced into the same clears **Every Fucking Game**, nothing changes for us anymore, even between different champions, you just clear what you need to, at least the Red > Krugs > 3 gank gave an interesting other path, but now not even that exists Simply because you wouldn't let players get used to that possible tactic.

And the worst part is, depending on your jungler your forced into very specific clears, because of Raptors AND Krugs, at least early.

Krugs aren't worth it for the first clear now, especially since they spawn late and you can't start them, the benefit to backtracking to get them WAS the level 3, now it's just got no worth.

Raptors are such a jungler specific camp that most junglers just skip this, and this means you are doing the same few clears.

Red > Wolves > Blue > Gromp
Blue > Wolves (> Gromp)  > Red

You haven't helped anyone with these sorts of changes, you've just made the good junglers better, and made it so that basically EVERY ad jungler has to buy a Tiamat or fall the fuck behind, and the AP ones just clear them or don't.

replies.body:
Im not a jungler, and pretty much the only two junglers i can play reliably are Kindred and Ivern.

So i cant speak for all junglers, but I can relay some of the problems Ivern faces. 

Ivern's clear speed on a single camp is average. But his clear speed of the whole jungle is phenomenal!
However this clear speed along with the slow respawn times of camps, means that in a game where all 3 lanes are pushed, you can do literally nothing!
You have to wait ages for the camps to re-spawn, (falling behind on gold and xp the whole time), you cant even use this time to effectively counter jungle, because you can only really conure jungle when you have smite, and even then, you can only take 1 camp because if you run into Lee Sin, you're actually fucked. 

Ivern also loses out on creep score when taking Krugs, because he cant explode them into smaller ones, he is only gets 2 CS instead of 10. (and i think he gets less gold and XP too. but I'm not sure)

I find the scrying plants useful, ward denial is a useful tool. But the other plants seem a little pointless imo. The honey fruit is useful, but is 100% luck, and its main purpose is to give a extra boost to counter junglers crossing the river (and in my opinion counter jungling is already too strong).
But I hate the exploding plants, all they do is give champs who couldn't usually chase you over walls, an easy way to get over the wall, which in a way, nullifies the advantage champions with a dash have over champions without a dash. 
The exploding fruit also is more a tool for counter junglers than anyone else, when they get caught out, they can easily escape into the river or dragon pit, and leaves the team that caught them out, with nothing (less not nothing actually because they lose out on lane farm and xp, chasing the invader)

So, imo there are a few good things in the new jungle, Krugs and raptors are great in mid and late game for some quick gold, for a team that cant afford to push. 
But I think the new jungle helps counter junglers too much, and imo, those are the champs that don't really need any help.

Just my 2 cents, from a mid laner  haha xD

>I find the scrying plants useful, ward denial is a useful tool.

The issue again, is what they replace, now you only have to use 1 auto to take an enemy's vision denial/gaining instead of going into the enemy jungle to use a smite.

i prefer'd smite buffs for wave clear as they gave more strategy, if i think they r invade, wolf smite, if im low mana, clear blue and smite it early so i have mana to clear it with, am i low, red smite heal, do i need auto power against monsters (or pushing a lane) krugs, (gromp was pretty useless to me) now we got heal, jump, and see, eh, doesnt feel that fun, all they did was add more troll potential

The buffs are fine, but the krugs and raptors basically demolish anyone without fast clear aoe clear speed. It's not a question of whether or not a jungler is viable but rather is it effective and the answer generally rests on a jungler's clear speed. 


Most junglers can easily do blue side without any leash nowadays but when it comes to the red side a rather large number of junglers will find it's only efficient to clear the red and then just recall, scuttle or look to  gank.

I just miss raptor buff and also not getting near executed by the jungle if I try to powerclear on certain champions. You used to be able to decide how to clear depending on the game type but atm if you're not well versed in your jungle champion and their clear kiting patterns, you'll need to take a break to get a honey fruit (which can be quick or very slow) or risk getting very low in the jungle. 

Now some junglers can clear the new jungle exceptionally fast and with almost full hp and mana but other poor clearing junglers and non-meta junglers can have a pretty hard time if they start bot, especially now that they can't hit lvl3 off kruggs  (now I know having the jungler at lvl3 whilst laners are about to hit lvl2 is stupid broken) which means they have to try to fight raptors at lvl2 or skip them. Skipping them means you'll have to go back for them later on farm junglers and also means you'll be tackling blue buff without a smite which is risky if the enemy jungler invades.

I don't have too much issue clearing the jungle since I generally play champions with excellent clear or the champions I play with poor clear, I'm well versed in how to kite with them but I've seen alot of people get executed, even in silver-gold level ranked games cause the jungler tries to take raptors and doesn't have an indepth understanding of how to clear efficiently on their champion, or the damage that raptors can put out if you don't have the correct runes.

Well if you miss Raptor buff you should have used it more.

The reason on smite buffs were removed was because come mid to late game (even late early game) the buffs weren't being used or taken.

And even in the rare cases that they were being used it was always Raptor buff.

the issues where kruggs buff wasn't really necessary later on the in the game since most junglers could easily clear by then. Gromp Buff didn't scale so lategame the damage it did barely made it worth considering. Wolf Spirit was a highly contested smite buff, but only the enemy wolf spirit was useful, raptors oracle buff was amazing at all stages of the game but I didn't see many players below silver who actually used it properly.

Gromp buff actually scaled with %max health of the user.
So for many Tank Junglers, especially ones like Sion, it was very useful, but again still extremely niche and rarely picked up.

Krugs buff was useful late game thanks to the massive damage hit to buildings, but again niche and rarely used.
i wouldve used that gromp buff way more if i knew it actually scaled

I am embarassed I didn't know those tricks, and here I claim to know the basics of jungling. 

Kruggs buff could be used once to do 50+(18 x lvl) true damage to a turret on the first auto and that's actually alot and Gromp Buff damage scaled better than I thought it did with 4+(8 x lvl) magic damage over 3s to people who attack the person who has it.

I learnt this too late what a shame but thanks for the insight. So I guess riot was right when they said the community didn't know what smite buffs did. I thought gromp passive only gained 2 magic damage per level and I wasn't aware of that huge chunk of true damage to towers krugss buff gave which would be awfully powerful if you wanted to rush a tower.
i like'd taking krug buff if i was on my way to push top

The main issue buffs have is that if you hand them off, you get 0 EXP from the camp, instead of when you could pick up the little guys.

Which is a huge trade off to make for a jungler when your EXP is heavily limited.
Unless your name is Ivern of course ;)

You get more gold and exp as a Jungler now than ever before.

Tossing aside a buff or two wont leave you behind like it used to.
